intro: Galearis rotundifolia f. beckettii, commonly known as the Beckett’s round-leaved gentian, is a flowering plant belonging to the Gentianaceae family. It is characterized by its rounded, velvety leaves and striking blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, this plant thrives in high-altitude, rocky environments. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly larger leaves and more robust floral structure compared to the typical form. It is a valued plant in botanical gardens for its ornamental beauty and ecological significance in alpine ecosystems.
